predictions.text: Berkshire Hathaway will publicly announce (press release or SEC 8-K) that Greg Abel has become CEO (effective date stated) by 2026-01-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Berkshire Hathaway (berkshirehathaway.com, PR Newswire, or an SEC filing including an 8-K) states Greg Abel is CEO with an effective date on or before 2026-01-15; otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent reporting indicates a near-term leadership transition and heightened investor focus on succession execution.
monitoring_signals: Berkshire Hathaway SEC filings (8-K)
Berkshire Hathaway newsroom / press releases
Major financial wires (WSJ, Reuters, CNBC) citing an official Berkshire statement
predictions.rationale: With succession described as imminent, a formal and dated public transition announcement is likely within weeks.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce at least 2 Venezuela-related SDN designations explicitly tied to crude/oil-product shipping or trading networks by 2026-02-28 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if U.S. Treasury/OFAC press releases or SDN updates (treasury.gov) between 2025-12-21 and 2026-02-28 include 2+ distinct Venezuela-related designations that mention maritime shipment, vessels, shipowners, traders, or oil export facilitation; otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent U.S. maritime enforcement action against a tanker carrying Venezuelan oil suggests increased operational focus and potential follow-on sanctions.
monitoring_signals: OFAC press releases and SDN list update notices
Treasury 'Recent Actions' feed filtering for Venezuela
Reuters/Bloomberg reports citing OFAC designations targeting shipping networks
predictions.rationale: Escalating enforcement often pairs operational interdictions with follow-on network designations to raise compliance risk for facilitators.

predictions.text: Reuters or Bloomberg will report that Venezuela’s seaborne crude+condensate exports (citing Kpler or Vortexa) fell below a 4-week average of 600,000 barrels/day at least once by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if Reuters or Bloomberg publishes a story on or before 2026-03-31 stating Venezuela exports fell below a 4-week average of 600 kb/d (explicitly citing Kpler and/or Vortexa); otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent U.S. interdiction activity increases the probability of temporary shipping disruptions and self-sanctioning by carriers/buyers.
monitoring_signals: Reuters/Bloomberg Venezuela oil export trackers
Kpler/Vortexa figures quoted in public media
Changes in Venezuelan export destinations, vessel queues, or delays reported in shipping press
predictions.rationale: Even brief enforcement spikes can cause episodic export drawdowns via delayed liftings and higher compliance risk.

predictions.text: A major tech trade association or frontier-AI developer will file a federal lawsuit challenging New York’s RAISE Act (or its implementing provisions) by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if a complaint is filed in U.S. federal court by 2026-03-31 with claims explicitly challenging the NY RAISE Act (named in the filing) and a plaintiff that is (i) a major AI company, or (ii) a major tech/industry association (e.g., Chamber/NetChoice/CCIA); otherwise NO.
evidence: NY signed a notable AI safety law, increasing compliance costs and incentivizing preemption/constitutional challenges.
monitoring_signals: PACER docket searches for 'RAISE Act' and 'New York' + AI
NetChoice/CCIA/Chamber litigation announcements
NY AG or state agency implementation notices prompting lawsuits
predictions.rationale: High-impact state tech regulations frequently draw rapid federal challenges on preemption, speech, and dormant commerce grounds.

predictions.text: At least one U.S. state legislature outside New York will introduce a bill that mandates safety evaluations or risk-management obligations specifically for 'frontier'/'foundation' AI models by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if an official state legislature website posts a newly introduced bill (first reading/filing) by 2026-06-30 that explicitly targets frontier/foundation models and requires safety testing/evaluations, incident reporting, or deployment gating; otherwise NO.
evidence: NY’s RAISE Act increases policy diffusion pressure among states absent comprehensive federal AI safety law.
monitoring_signals: California, Illinois, Massachusetts legislative trackers for AI safety/foundation model bills
NCSL summaries on AI legislation
Public statements from state attorneys general and governors on 'frontier AI' rules
predictions.rationale: State policy diffusion is common when a first-mover law creates a template and advocacy momentum.

predictions.text: A bipartisan U.S. Senate bill establishing a federal regulatory framework for payment stablecoins will be introduced by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if a stablecoin framework bill is introduced in the U.S. Senate by 2026-03-31 with at least 1 Democratic and 1 Republican sponsor/co-sponsor at introduction, and the text/summary is principally about payment stablecoin issuance and oversight; otherwise NO.
evidence: A key Senate vacancy may reshuffle committee dynamics while stablecoin policy remains a recurring bipartisan topic.
monitoring_signals: Congress.gov new Senate bill filings for 'stablecoin'
Senate Banking Committee press releases
Statements from Treasury/FSOC urging stablecoin legislation
predictions.rationale: Stablecoin legislation has repeated near-miss history; committee reconfiguration often triggers a renewed bipartisan push.

predictions.text: S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller 20-city home price index will show year-over-year growth below 0.0% (negative YoY) in at least one release published by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if any Case-Shiller 20-city composite index release date on or before 2026-06-30 reports the index’s YoY percent change < 0.0%; otherwise NO.
evidence: Affordability pressures persist as housing costs and borrowing costs have outpaced wage gains.
monitoring_signals: Case-Shiller monthly releases (S&P Dow Jones Indices)
Mortgage rate levels and purchase application trends
Inventory and price-cut metrics (Redfin/Zillow) leading indicators
predictions.rationale: High rates and stretched affordability raise odds of at least a temporary negative YoY print in a major price index.

predictions.text: Google will announce general availability in the U.S. of a Gemini-powered AI answer feature integrated into core Search (not limited to an invite-only experiment) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if Google posts an official announcement (The Keyword / Google Search blog) by 2026-06-30 stating a Gemini-powered AI answer/summary feature is generally available in U.S. Search to broad users (language like 'rolling out broadly', 'available to all', or 'generally available'), not restricted to labs/testers; otherwise NO.
evidence: Google is reorganizing leadership to protect search dominance amid generative AI competition.
monitoring_signals: Google Search blog / The Keyword announcements
Product UI rollout notes and help-center documentation
Advertiser communications about AI answer placements
predictions.rationale: Competitive pressure from generative AI increases likelihood of broader Search integration and formal GA language.

predictions.text: The Minor Planet Center will publish an orbit solution and official designation confirming the newly observed object as an interstellar comet (I/ designation) by 2026-01-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if the Minor Planet Center (minorplanetcenter.net) issues an MPEC/circular by 2026-01-31 assigning an I/ designation and publishing orbital elements for the object; otherwise NO.
evidence: NASA reported observation of a rare interstellar comet, typically followed by MPC designation after sufficient astrometry.
monitoring_signals: Minor Planet Center MPEC feed for new I/ designations
NASA/JPL Small-Body Database updates
IAU/MPC announcements about hyperbolic orbit confirmation
predictions.rationale: Once candidate interstellar status is public, confirmation and formal MPC designation usually follow quickly with additional observations.

predictions.text: The U.S. Treasury (OFAC or FinCEN) will issue at least one public advisory or alert explicitly warning financial institutions about sanctions-evasion typologies involving Venezuelan oil shipments by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: YES if OFAC or FinCEN posts an advisory/alert by 2026-06-30 that explicitly mentions Venezuelan oil shipment sanctions evasion (e.g., AIS spoofing, STS transfers, document fraud) and provides compliance guidance; otherwise NO.
evidence: Recent maritime enforcement actions elevate compliance risk and increase demand for typology guidance to the private sector.
monitoring_signals: OFAC advisories page updates
FinCEN advisories and AML alerts
Industry compliance bulletins citing new U.S. government typology guidance
predictions.rationale: Enforcement escalations often coincide with typology advisories to operationalize compliance and deter facilitation.
